text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen today i 
am gonna take you back to my elementary school

cafeteria in thailand where they used to sell 
the most delicious little snacks called kai

tao which literally means turtle eggs but don't 
worry they're not actually turtle eggs they are

a little sweet potato donut shaped in little 
balls so they end up looking a bit like turtle

eggs some people like to call them kind okra thai 
which means quail eggs but they don't actually

look like quail eggs so I'm going with turtle 
eggs and they are the sort of chewy a little

bit sweet just so addictive in Munchie and it's 
actually really really easy to make especially

considering Donuts can be a bit tricky so let's 
get started let's first talk the main ingredients

the sweet potato so this recipe will work with 
any kind of sweet potato except and this is so

important the orange flesh ones that in North 
America we typically call yams ok the problem

with that is it's got the highest moisture content 
and it'll actually make the dough too wet for this

particular recipe if you do use those you end up 
just having to add so much flour in order to be

able to shape them and then it's just not as good 
because then there's too much flour so I will show

you the three types that I have used successfully 
before so this one is the one I'm using today at

my store they call it Japanese yams this one is 
super cool cut it open on the inside and it's like

this marble effect super cool and this is the one 
that's available all the time is the white flesh

sweet potato and if you have a different kind of 
sweet potato in your area that's not shown here

and when you steam it it's not too wet it's on 
the drier side it'll probably work as well like

for example there's one that's sort of this long 
shape but it's really dark purple on the inside

that works too and it makes the most beautiful 
purple donuts so I have just peeled my sweet

potato and cut them into sort of 1-inch chunks I'm 
gonna steam them so they're fully fully cooked and

I am using this cool little steamer which kind 
of looks like something from a sci-fi a a movie

but it works really well when you just want to see 
him a little bit of stuff I'm gonna pop these in

a pot of water make sure the water does not come 
up above the rack and you want to let them go for

a full 10 to 15 minutes until they're completely 
soft now when you test it use a fork not a knife

you don't want something sharp that would give you 
the idea that it's softer than it is and just poke

it and there should be zero resistance you want 
this to mush really smoothly so if it's still got

a little resistance you have a hard time with it 
transfer this onto a plate we just like that see

it should just go in completely easily with no 
effort and it's so much fun yeah beautiful all

right so now I'm gonna just transfer my sweet 
potato into here the dough is very easy I'm

gonna just add some sugar and then just a little 
bit of salt and I'm just gonna stir that in first

so that the sugar dissolves baby food okay and now 
we're gonna add our starches so the first and most

important starch is tapioca starch this is what's 
going to give it that chewiness bounciness you

know think bubble tea the pearls in bubble tea 
that's made from tapioca starch so that's sort

of the bounciness it's gonna give us this is the 
bag that it comes in it's available at any Asian

grocery store or Latin American stores we'll also 
have this as well tapioca alone is a little too

bouncy you want to like offset it with a little 
softness so I'm gonna add some wheat flour so

this is all-purpose flour and a little baking 
powder for a little airiness with baking powder

I always like to sift it in because sometimes 
there are little clumps in it and I just want to

avoid the risk of having clumps of baking powder 
see like these clumps like that if that just ends

up unmixed it tastes awful baking powder doesn't 
taste good and mix it in I still need to add my

liquid my coconut milk but I like to give this a 
brief mix first just to gauge where I'm at with

moisture content because the last thing I want 
to do is add too much coconut milk I then have

a hard time forming them into balls so with 
this I know that one tables boon of coconut

milk is definitely safe see when I tried it with 
the orange sweet potato the orange yams like I

didn't have to add any coconut milk at all and 
it was still too wet so it just didn't work at

all so I just want to work the coconut milk in 
a tablespoon at a time and see this is why the

drier the sweet potato the better it is because 
the more coconut flavor you can incorporate so if

you're wondering okay is that enough just try 
to form it into a ball and if it rolls easily

doesn't stick to your hand that's perfect but it 
also should be moist it shouldn't be really hard

and stiff and whatnot so I think two tablespoons 
I'm going to stop right there and that's it let's

roll them rolling balls now you can make these as 
big or as small as you like within reasons but I

think a good size is about if you take a teaspoon 
like a measuring spoon and then you sort of like

keep it a little bit like this that seems to me 
to be a decent size and then you just roll them

into a ball in Thailand now they also have these 
stuffed with cheese like mozzarella cheese inside

and it's kind of like a novelty item you can 
try that too so it's a really forgiving recipe

all right so I got all my balls rolls out now you 
can make this far in advance by the way just make

it put in the fridge you can fry them up tomorrow 
if you want that's another great thing about this

recipe so I've got some just vegetable oil frying 
oil I'm gonna fry them at 325 degree Fahrenheit

that's a little lower than normal and I don't 
want this to go any higher than 350 because I

want to give them lots of time to fry that's 
how they're gonna develop a crisp crust if the

oil is too hot they'll Brown really fast cook 
really fast and the outside will be soft you

don't want that I'm gonna start dropping these 
and right away I want to be moving them around

cuz if you take your time dropping them what's 
gonna happen is the bottom side of these falls

are gonna get a dark patch okay so as soon as they 
go down you want to be moving them around all the

time with this recipe you're kind of a slave to 
the stove because in the beginning they sink and

you need to stir them otherwise they get a brown 
patch and after a while as they lose more water

they'll float and then you still need to stir them 
because otherwise the part that's above the oil

is not gonna get nicely browned so you're kind of 
stuck okay and you want to give these a solid five

minutes to fry any less than that again you're 
not gonna get as crisp of a crust so even if the

color looks done give them five minutes anyway oh 
yeah check this out so it's been five minutes and

I want to get them out and then I like to put them 
on paper towel rather than a rack because I find

that it allows the surface oil to be absorbed and 
then I just kind of roll them around a little bit

so that all the surface oil can absorb or you can 
put another one on top and roll them like this

and that's it don't eat them right now they're so 
hot they will burn you so bad trust me I've done

it many many times by the way once they've been 
through the paper towel station I like to let

them cool off on a rack because it doesn't trap 
steam and so it stays crisp longer but speaking

of crisp this is not something you make in the 
morning and half for dessert okay like this is

yeah it's street food right you buy it you eat 
it right away the crispy on the outside soft on

the inside which means softness inside is gonna 
make the outside soggy quick so you want to eat

this while they're still warm preferably okay 
and let me just show you what they look like on

the inside whoo you can hear that the outside is 
a little crisp oh yes see that it's got a little

bit of airiness but it's really sort of soft 
and squishy and oh so good oh I can smell that

coconut I can't begin to tell you how good this 
is you can really taste the sweet potato as you

saw there's a ton of sweet potato imagine mochi 
hey that chewiness but much softer and airier I

mean it's so good they're so addictive like I can 
stand here and just eat half of these all in one

go they're so dangerous back when I was little 
in my elementary school they used to sell five

of these balls five falls above the size for 
one baht okay you can google at 1 baht and see

what that means in your currency but I used 
to love it cuz I thought it was such a good

deal and they would come in like little paper 
cones my favorite thing ever so I hope you give

this a try they are so so easy and again least 
should be eat fresh so maybe if you have people

over you can just pry them off you know live as 
people are there to be so so fun the recipe as

always will be on hot I teach em calm when you 
make it send me a photo on Facebook Twitter or

Instagram I am also on Pinterest as well if you 
are Pinner and if you haven't subscribed to the

show make sure you do so you don't miss an episode 
and click that little bell icon as well so you get

a notification when I post a new video if you love 
the show and you want to support us check out our

patreon link in the description below and I will 
see you next time for your next edition hi you
